channel.title: Lisa Stickan
channel.description: Lisa Stickan Chairman, Young Republicans (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: As Chairman of the Young Republicans National Federation, I hear from young people all over the country, especially back home in Ohio.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: And times are bad under Barack Obama and his leadership.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: The labor force participation is at its lowest level in 30 years. Twenty-three million Americans are unemployed, underemployed, or have stopped looking for work.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: And quite simply, the jobs just aren't there. Household incomes have fallen and their debt has risen.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: We're paying more for healthcare and getting less choice. There's a war on young people, a war on paychecks and a war on our ability to succeed.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: We're working to build our own businesses, struggling to pave our own way, only to learn that, according to this president, we didn't build it.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: But there is hope -- for the change of a new day. Governor Mitt Romney has a plan to get this country back on track and the Young Republicans are excited.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: We're ready for the government to get out of the way so job creators can actually create jobs. We're ready for leadership that leads from the front.
item.author: Lisa Stickan

item.title: We're ready to elect Governor Mitt Romney. ###
item.author: Lisa Stickan
